subtitle: A great way to use leftover cooked lamb.

method.text: Cut the tops off the tomatoes. Scoop out the seeds and flesh. Season the tomato insides, then stand them upside down to drain.

Heat half the oil in a pan and cook the onion and garlic for 2 min. Add the rice and stir over a low heat for 2 min. Add 300 ml of the stock and cook gently, stirring, until the liquid has been absorbed. Repeat as before with the next 300 ml of stock and again with the final amount of stock.
Stir in the lamb and thyme. Arrange the tomatoes in a greased roasting tin. Fill each tomato with the rice mixture. Drizzle over the remaining oil. Bake for 30 min.

title: Greek stuffed tomatoes
